Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyze the Event Log (Case by Case): Case C001: Initiate Request (WebPortal) -> Start. Verify Documents (BackOffice) -> Initial check. Call Customer (Frontline) -> Context: Verification incomplete, requesting missing docs. This is a Request for Information call. Submit Additional (Customer) -> Providing missing info. Verify Documents (BackOffice) -> Context: Re-checking after new info. This is a Re-verification. Approve Request (Supervisor) -> End. Case C002: ... Case C003: ...

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Identify Ambiguous Activities: Verify Documents: Occurs at the beginning (Initial Check). Occurs after additional info or adjustments (Re-Check). Distinction: Initial vs. Subsequent/Re-verification. Call Customer: C001: Requesting missing docs (Information Request). C002 (1st): Clarifying discrepancy (Investigation). C002 (2nd): Confirming changes (Confirmation). C003: Calling a walk-in customer who stepped away (Recall/Notification). Distinction: The purpose of the call varies significantly.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Initiate Request: Appears once per case. The prompt says Identify activities that appear multiple times within the same case. Initiate Request appears once per case. Approve Request appears once per case. Adjust Account appears once per case. Focus: The main offenders are Verify Documents and Call Customer. C001: Verify Documents (2x), Call Customer (1x). C002: Verify Documents (1x), Call Customer (2x). C003: Verify Documents (2x), Call Customer (1x).

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Drafting New Names: Verify Documents: First occurrence: Perform Initial Document Verification. Second occurrence: Perform Document Re-verification. Call Customer: C001 (Missing docs): Request Missing Documentation via Phone. C002 (1st - Discrepancy): Investigate Account Discrepancy via Phone. C002 (2nd - Confirm): Confirm Account Adjustments via Phone. C003 (Walk-in stepped out): Recall Customer to Service Counter.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Refining the Log: I need to make sure the new names fit the table structure. Consider if Initiate Request should be split by channel (Online vs Branch). Strictly speaking, only Verify Documents and Call Customer repeat within a single case. Self-Correction on Initiate Request: While it doesnt repeat within a case... Decision: I will only rename Verify Documents and Call Customer as these are the ones explicitly repeating within cases.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final Review of the Plan: Check timestamps and order (must remain unchanged). Check Case IDs (must remain unchanged). Ensure new names are descriptive but concise. Ensure the justification maps back to the Additional Context column. Revised Plan: Verify Documents -> Initial Document Verification / Re-verify Documents. Call Customer -> Specific purpose (Request Info, Investigate, Confirm, Recall).

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Refining Names for Consistency: Verify Documents (1st time in case) -> Perform Initial Document Verification. Verify Documents (2nd time in case) -> Perform Document Re-Verification. Call Customer (C001) -> Contact Customer: Request Missing Docs. Call Customer (C002-1) -> Contact Customer: Investigate Discrepancy. Call Customer (C002-2) -> Contact Customer: Confirm Adjustments. Call Customer (C003) -> Contact Customer: In-Branch Recall.
